intro: Malvastrum bakerianum, commonly known as the desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, adapting to the harsh desert environment. Malvastrum bakerianum is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it a hardy choice for xeriscaping.
